com.mapdigit.gis.geometry

Class GeoPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoPoint
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeoLatLng

    public class GeoPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    A point representing a location in (x,y) coordinate space, specified in integer precision.
    © Copyright 2009 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double x
      The X coordinate of this GeoPoint.
      double y
      The Y coordinate of this GeoPoint.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeoPoint()
      Constructs and initializes a point at the origin (0, 0) of the coordinate space.
      GeoPoint(double x, double y)
      Constructs and initializes a point at the specified (x,y) location in the coordinate space.
      GeoPoint(GeoPoint p)
      Constructs and initializes a point with the same location as the specified Point object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to a specified GeoPoint.

      Returns the square of the distance from this GeoPoint to a specified point.

      Returns the square of the distance between two points.
      double distanceSq(GeoPoint pt)
      Returns the square of the distance from this GeoPoint to a specified GeoPoint.

      Determines whether or not two points are equal.

      return the x coordinate.

      Returns a string representation of this point and its location in the (x,y) coordinate space.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this point and its location in the (x,y) coordinate space. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a string that contains the x and y coordinates, in this order, separated by a comma.

      • distanceSq

        public static double distanceSq(double x1,
                double y1,
                double x2,
                double y2)
        Returns the square of the distance between two points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the X coordinate of the first specified point
        y1 - the Y coordinate of the first specified point
        x2 - the X coordinate of the second specified point
        y2 - the Y coordinate of the second specified point
        Returns:
        the square of the distance between the two sets of specified coordinates.

        Parameters:

        py - the Y coordinate of the specified point to be measured against this GeoPoint
        Returns:
        the square of the distance between this GeoPoint and the specified point.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determines whether or not two points are equal. Two instances of GeoPoint are equal if the values of their x and y member fields, representing their position in the coordinate space, are the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - an object to be compared with this GeoPoint
        Returns:
        true if the object to be compared is an instance of GeoPoint and has the same values; false otherwise.
